TopicTitle: KSP 0.90 wont run properly the KSP scene and the editor wont run!

Im being left behind ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-31T03:44:17Z" title="03/31/2015 03:44  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 31, 2015</time> by Claw**

I think we would ask for logs from an unmodded install first. And hopefully one of our linux gurus will be along soon-ish.

Cheers,

~Claw

> 
> I think we would ask for logs from an unmodded install first. And hopefully one of our linux gurus will be along soon-ish.
> Cheers,
> 
> ~Claw

OK I'll send it when I can, my older brothers in college so the pc I play KSP on is frequently occupied by him

Also send through as much details as you can about the PC - RAM, Graphics Card, Linux distro and version, drivers, etc.

Have you tried the various graphics settings, especially "fallback shaders" in the options?

Yes we will need the logs, please see the stickied threads for more, but I have seen this before and usually it's caused by Unity3D anti-aliasing being broken on Linux, mostly on AMD graphics cards.

Try disabling anti-aliasing in Settings, also it's a good idea to disable PPFX edge highlighting as it needs AA to work anyway.

You can use the Catalyst control center or Nvidia settings manager to enable anti-aliasing via the graphics hardware directly, either for all OpenGL applications or on a per-program basis ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This looks like a graphics driver problem, possibly with 3D acceleration. Try reinstalling or updating your drivers to the latest driver for your card, update opengl, and check if Direct Rendering is working.

[http://pastebin.com/0s6zgguJ](http://pastebin.com/0s6zgguJ)
